title: Is there a time between BC and AD? If yes, then what is it called? - Quora

response.answer_text: As Govind Sharma points out, the answer is no. Keep in mind the BC/AD (or BCE/CE) numbering system was put into place retroactively. It wasn’t until at least the 500s AD that Westerners began dating events relative to the putative date of the Birth of Christ: AD stands for “Anno Domini,” or “the year of the Lord, and BC stands for “Before Christ.” Thus, there is no “year zero” in this dating system, since 1 BC was followed by 1 AD.
